item.title: Representing Spatial Velocities
item.description: I’ve been going through Russ Tedrake’s notes on robotics, which got me thinking about their so-called monogram notation. Basically, this is the notation that represents an $SE(3)$ transformation as $^aX^b$ â€” more on that shortly. There is a recent review paper that points to several variations on this notation, and my postdoc advisor Gregory Chirikjian wrote a paper on it as well. Tedrake’s monogram notation looks very elegant until you get to spatial velocities, at which point strange artifacts such as the “cross product” will appear. $\newcommand{\mf}[1]{\mathbf{#1}}$ $\newcommand{\mono}[4]{ { ^{#2} #1 ^{#3} _{#4} } }$
